item.title: Climate Change
item.description: Climate Change About Climate Change There is broad consensus within the scientific community that human activity is changing the Earth’s climate through increasing concentrations of greenhouse gases (GHGs) — primarily carbon dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4), nitrous oxide (N2O), and chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) — in the atmosphere. Scientists have predicted that unless GHG emissions are substantially stemmed by the end of the century, climate change will become irreversible. A key part of combating climate change is mitigation, which means reducing GHG emissions.
